intro: Leucojum carpathicum, commonly known as the Carpathian white squill, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces a tall stem bearing umbels of white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in woodland and shady areas, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Leucojum carpathicum is valued for its ornamental beauty and is often cultivated in gardens for its elegant appearance.
